text:
The DailyRollingFileAppender will discard any logged data once the next logging 
period has been reached, for the first roll-over. For example, if my log-file 
is myLog.log and my app. starts logging with DatePattern='.'yyyy-MM-dd-HH at 
10.45am, then at 11.00am I end up with a file called myLog.log which is missing 
the logged data from 10.45-11.00am. At 12.00pm the log file rolls over 
successfully to the next hour and I then have two files: myLog.log.2001-10-11-
11 and myLog.log. So, if logging every minute I could lose upto 59s of logging; 
if logging every hour upto 59m of logging; and if rolling over every midnight, 
a whole day of logging.
creator: william.ferreira@cqsm.com

text: Do you see this in log4j 1.2?
creator: ceki@apache.org
